title: 有冇人可以分析下依句英文結構

replies.msg:
That Seoul seeks to set its own policy has shocked hawkish analysts who assume confrontation is the best and only sensible policy toward the PRC. For instance, Mathew Ha of the Foundation for the Defense of Democracies blamed the South’s failure to adopt the Trump agenda on fear of Chinese retaliation, which he believed should be addressed through bribery, a promise to reimburse Seoul for any costs incurred. He warned of “China’s hand” and “Beijing’s sway,” which he saw involved in a nefarious attempt “to undermine U.S. alliances.” Obviously, the South Koreans were incapable of thinking and acting for themselves.
Ironically, also attempting to undermine the U.S.-ROK alliance, if not the rest of America’s alliances was Japan’s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe.

用左倒裝? 硬係load唔到點解
但google translate又冇問題

Ironically, Japan’s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was also attempting to undermine the U.S.-ROK alliance, if not the rest of America’s alliances .
句野意思係咁？

人哋兩段字，你咁樣cut出嚟睇梗係唔明
「諷刺地，安倍亦在嘗試削弱美韓聯盟，以至美國與各國的聯盟」係段首，後面跟住成段都係解釋

quote.msg:
Ironically, Japan’s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was also attempting to undermine the U.S.-ROK alliance, if not the rest of America’s alliances .
句野意思係咁？

replies.msg:
大致係咁
但唔sure確實意思係咪 依家美國既盟友都想動搖美韓聯盟 但安倍做得最明顯
定係 得安倍係一眾美國盟友之中動搖美韓聯盟

quote.msg:
人哋兩段字，你咁樣cut出嚟睇梗係唔明
「諷刺地，安倍亦在嘗試削弱美韓聯盟，以至美國與各國的聯盟」係段首，後面跟住成段都係解釋

replies.msg:
哦屌 冇野
thank you

quote.msg:
Ironically, Japan’s Prime Minister Shinzo Abe was also attempting to undermine the U.S.-ROK alliance, if not the rest of America’s alliances .
句野意思係咁？

大致係咁
但唔sure確實意思係咪 依家美國既盟友都想動搖美韓聯盟 但安倍做得最明顯
定係 得安倍係一眾美國盟友之中動搖美韓聯盟

replies.msg:
你連樓上幫你改寫嗰句你都讀錯喎師兄 少少難搞
if not嗰句係補充us-rok alliance以外仲有其他喎
通常if not跟嗰舊吹大啲（全部alliance) 只係實際上會窄啲（前面嗰句 us-rok）
例如Many, if not most, fans of mu are cheap.
